data.title: Latin American Crypto Exchange Ripio Launches Argentine Peso Stablecoin 'wARS'
data.description:
Latin American cryptocurrency exchange Ripio has officially launched a new stablecoin named 'wARS,' which is pegged to the Argentine peso. This innovative digital currency aims to provide a stable and reliable means of transaction within the cryptocurrency market, especially in Argentina, where economic fluctuations can impact the value of traditional currencies. With the introduction of wARS, Ripio is positioning itself as a key player in the expanding ecosystem of stablecoins in the region, offering users a more secure and stable alternative for conducting their financial activities.
source: https://www.coindesk.com/markets/2025/11/01/latin-american-crypto-exchange-ripio-launches-argentine-peso-stablecoin-wars

data.title: Gold Surges in October as Bitcoin Experiences Decline
data.description: According to PANews, October witnessed a significant rise in gold prices, while the Nasdaq index also saw an increase, highlighting a rotation among assets. Bitcoin, however, experienced a nearly 5% decline in October, breaking its streak of consecutive monthly gains. After reaching an all-time high of over $126,000 on October 6, Bitcoin's value plummeted, dropping to around $104,000 between October 10 and 11. This marks the first time in six years that Bitcoin has ended October with a loss. Despite the monthly decline, Bitcoin has still risen over 16% year-to-date.

data.title: BlackRock signals selling these 2 cryptocurrencies worth $500‚ÄØmillion
data.description:
As the broader cryptocurrency market remains in a consolidation phase, BlackRock, the world‚Äôs largest investment management firm, has moved a significant amount of digital assets, signaling potential selling activity. According to data from Arkham, retrieved by Finbold on November 1, BlackRock transferred a total of $506 million in cryptocurrencies. On-chain data shows that roughly 3,496 Bitcoin (BTC), valued at about $384 million, and 31,754 Ethereum (ETH), worth approximately $122 million, were moved to Coinbase Prime. The transactions were traced to wallets linked to BlackRock‚Äôs iShares Bitcoin ETF (IBIT) and iShares Ethereum ETF (ETHA)
source: https://finbold.com/blackrock-signals-selling-these-2-cryptocurrencies-worth-500-million/
